metadata.title: CVE-2022-2905 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in the Linux kernel's BPFsubsystem in how a user calls the bpf_tail_call function with a key largerthan the max_entries of the map. This flaw allows a local user to gainunauthorized access to data.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
